title: Satay noodles
description: If you love peanut butter then Katy Beskow’s noodle recipe is the meal for you. Fresh, light, spicy and full of crunch – this quick and easy dish is ready to eat in just a quarter of an hour.
ingredients: Small handful sugar snap peas, halved
2 spring onions, sliced on the diagonal
2 x 150g packs soft egg-free ready-to-wok noodles
2 tsp sesame seeds, small handful fresh coriander, 1 red chilli, deseeded and finely sliced, and roughly chopped peanuts to garnish

method.Step 1: To make the sauce, whisk together the peanut butter, soy sauce and chilli flakes along with 200ml cold water in a bowl. Whisk in the lime juice to form a smooth paste, adding an extra splash of water to loosen the mixture if needed.

method.Step 2: For the noodles, heat the oil in a wok over a high heat. When the oil is hot, throw in the vegetables and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Separate the soft noodles and add them to the wok. Pour in the peanut sauce and stir-fry for another minute. Serve sprinkled with sesame seeds, coriander, chilli and peanuts.
